plugins.name: Heurator
plugins.description:
Elevate your design critique process with Heurator, a powerful Figma plugin that brings Nielsen's 10 Usability Heuristics directly into your workflow.


Document, visualize, and solve usability issues with precision—all without leaving your design files.


✓ Pinpoint violations with customizable severity ratings

✓ Generate visually striking evaluation cards linked to problem areas

✓ Create actionable recommendations to improve user experience

✓ Maintain consistent evaluation criteria across your team


Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interface—whether human or AI-designed—ensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.
plugins.tagline: Because Even AI-Generated UIs Need Human-Centered Evaluation

plugins.name: Scenario Stamp
plugins.description:
Scenario Stamp helps product designers create clean, consistent headers for their prototype flows. Add project names, scenario titles, and essential metadata—so developers and stakeholders instantly understand what they're looking at.


No more guessing games or messy handoffs. Just drop in a stamp, label your work, and keep your Figma files organized and handoff-ready.


✅ Perfect for:


Organizing prototype flows


Prepping for developer handoff


Communicating design intent


Making your files easier to navigate


Make your designs speak for themselves—with Scenario Stamp.

accepted.name: prosha amiri
accepted.description: I'm the kind of designer who builds like an engineer, thinks like a strategist, and sketches like an artist.

plugins.tagline: Stamp clarity on every flow.

plugins.name: xps.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import XPS documents (.xps and .oxps)
plugins.description:
Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs.


Convert any XPS document into Figma designs. Import your XPS into Figma as designs with fully editable text layers, or as static, pixel-perfect images.


How to import XPS documents into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, xps.to.design
  2. Upload your file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your document will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use xps.to.design?

  1. Extract images and text from your XPSs and get them straight into Figma.
  2. Collaborate on XPS documents with your team in Figma.
  3. Use XPS as templates for new designs in Figma.
  4. And much more!


FREE

  1. 5 imports
  2. Imports as editable layers: First 3 pages only


PRO License

  1. Full features, multiple files at once and unlimited imports
  2. $49 for single user 1-year (not recurring)

or

  1. $99 for 3 users 1-year (not recurring)

accepted.name: divRIOTS
accepted.description: Making better tools so designers and developers can focus on what matters and work collaboratively as a team.

plugins.tagline: Import any XPS document as fully editable Figma designs

plugins.name: FigCrawl
plugins.description:
FigCrawl: Your FigJam Content Extractor


What is FigCrawl?

FigCrawl is a powerful FigJam plugin that transforms your collaborative boards into structured, AI-ready data. It intelligently extracts and organizes all your board's content while preserving the visual hierarchy and relationships between elements.


Use Cases

For Designers & Teams

  1. Extract structured content from brainstorming sessions
  2. Convert visual collaboration into actionable data
  3. Document and archive board content
  4. Share board content in a structured format


For AI/LLM Integration

  1. Feed board content into AI tools
  2. Generate summaries and reports
  3. Analyze relationships between ideas
  4. Create structured documentation


For Documentation

  1. Export board content for documentation
  2. Create structured reports
  3. Archive important board sessions
  4. Share insights with stakeholders



How It Works

  1. Launch: Open the plugin in your FigJam board
  2. Extract: Click "Extract Content" to scan your board
  3. Review: See a summary of extracted content
  4. Copy: Choose to copy the entire board or individual pages
  5. Use: Paste the JSON into your preferred AI tool or LLM
plugins.tagline: Extract FigJam content into AI-ready data with one click

126334.name: FigCrawl
126334.description:

126334.tagline: Extract FigJam content into AI-ready data with one click

plugins.name: Lumos Design Toolkit
plugins.description:
Lumos Design Toolkit is a powerful Figma plugin that streamlines your design workflow by providing essential tools for managing design systems, variables, text styles, and file organization. It helps designers maintain consistency, save time, and improve collaboration across design projects.


✨ Key Features


🎨 Variables Management

•Import from JSON – Bring your design tokens into Figma with just a few clicks

•Light & Dark Mode Support – Import variables for multiple modes effortlessly

•Smart Conflict Handling – Choose to overwrite, skip, or rename existing variables

•Organize with Collections – Group and manage your variables into clean collections


📝 Text Styles

•Create Custom Styles – Define fonts, sizes, weights, and line heights that match your system

•Apply in One Click – Select a text layer and apply styles instantly

•Live Preview – See exactly how your styles will look before creating

•Full Style Control – View, apply, or delete styles from a single interface


📄 Page Management

•Quick Page Creation – Add new pages without the manual setup

•Batch Mode – Create multiple pages at once by listing names line-by-line

•Organize with Ease – Rename, reorder, and delete pages from one place


🚀 Starter Templates

•Working File Structure – Automatically generate pages like Cover, Research, Drafts, and Final Designs

•Design System Setup – Instantly build a system with pages for Typography, Colors, Components, Layouts, Templates, and Docs
plugins.tagline: Lumos Design Toolkit is a powerful Figma plugin

126376.release_notes:

You can now choose a style folder and set a custom name when creating text styles—making it easier to stay organized and consistent in your files.
•Bug Fixes & Improvements
We cleaned up a few bugs and made some small improvements to keep things running smoothly.

plugins.name: Import AppStore Screenshots
plugins.description:
Screens.farm


How to import iOS screenshots into Figma

  1. In figma, open the plugin menu and launch "Appstore Screenshots"
  2. Enter the iOS app name or url
  3. Click Import


✅ Screenshots are added to your canvas, perfectly aligned and ready to use.


---


Why use screens.farm?

  1. Save hours by skipping the download → upload → organize loop
  2. Instantly grab all App Store screenshots in one click
  3. Create moodboards, presentations, or competitor benchmarks effortlessly
  4. Speed up your app store page redesign workflow
  5. Collaborate with teams on real product screenshots, directly in Figma


---


🎁 FREE version includes limited app imports


---


🚀 License


Unlock the full power of **screens.farm** with a PRO license:


  1. Unlimited app imports
  2. Faster imports with priority processing
  3. Import iPhone & iPad screenshots
  4. Premium support


---


Stop wasting time downloading screenshots one by one.

Let screens.farm do the heavy lifting — so you can focus on design.

plugins.name: Private Notes
plugins.description:
Private Notes allows you to attach personal annotations to any layer in your Figma file that remain completely private to you.


  1. Truly Private: Notes are stored locally and their contents are only visible to you, never to other collaborators
  2. Visual Markers: Customisable markers show where you've left notes (only visible when you run the plugin)
  3. Flexible Positioning: Place note markers in 8 different positions around your layers that stay fixed to the right frame.
  4. Persistent Storage: Your notes remain attached to layers even when you close and reopen Figma


Perfect for designers who want to keep track of personal thoughts, reminders, and to-dos without cluttering the file with comments visible to everyone.


Use it for recording client feedback, noting implementation details, or leaving yourself breadcrumbs for areas that need further attention.


Please contact me for any feedback. suggestions or issues!
plugins.tagline: Keep your thoughts private- annotations only you can see.

plugins.name: Text Styles from CSV
plugins.description:
**Text Styles from CSV** is a Figma plugin that allows users to import text styles directly from a CSV file, saving time and ensuring consistency across projects.


### ✨ Features:

- 📂 Import text styles from a CSV file with one click.

- 🔠 Supports font family, weight, size, letter spacing, and line height.

- 🎨 Automatically creates text styles in Figma for easy reuse.

- ⚡ Speeds up the design process by reducing manual styling.


### 📌 How It Works:

1. Open the plugin in Figma.

2. Upload your CSV file containing text style definitions.

3. Click "Import" to instantly create and apply styles.


For more details, check the **[GitHub Repository](https://github.com/metagrati/text-styles-from-csv).**
plugins.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

120678.name: Text Styles from CSV
120678.description:

120678.tagline: Import text styles into Figma from a CSV file. Automate typography styles creation.

plugins.name: 切图尺寸整合 Image Size Integration
plugins.description:
介绍

切图尺寸整合插件让 Figma 用户能够高效地管理和整合图像，适用于框架、组、组件等设计元素。通过该插件，您可以调整图像大小，并应用统一的尺寸以确保设计的一致性。


功能说明

  1. 允许用户选择多个元素（框架、组、组件、文本、实例等）。
  2. 自动计算所选元素的最大宽度和最大高度。
  3. 在预览框内显示每个选定的图像，用户可以选择保持原始尺寸或根据最长边进行缩放。
  4. 开关功能：切换保持图像原始尺寸或根据预览框大小调整图像。
  5. 提供灵活的控制选项，用于调整图像在预览框中的显示方式。


使用方法

  1. 选择您想要预览和调整的元素（框架、组、文本、组件、实例等）。
  2. 点击“生成Base64预览图”按钮以生成图像预览。
  3. 使用开关切换，选择是保持图像原始尺寸还是根据预览框尺寸进行缩放。
  4. 在插件界面直接查看调整后的图像及其对应尺寸。


注意事项

  1. 本插件支持栅格图像和矢量元素。
  2. 图像将显示在固定大小的预览框内，缩放设置会根据您的开关选择进行应用。
  3. 插件操作依赖于 Figma 画布上的选中元素，请确保在使用插件前选中正确的元素。


Introduction

Image Size Integration allows Figma users to efficiently manage and integrate images within frames, groups, and components. With this plugin, you can adjust image sizes and apply uniform dimensions for a consistent design output.


Function Description

  1. Allows users to select multiple elements (Frames, Groups, Components, Text, Instances, etc.) in a Figma design.
  2. Automatically calculates the maximum width and height from the selected elements.
  3. Displays each selected image inside a preview box, either maintaining its original size or resizing it based on the longest side, as determined by the user's settings.
  4. A toggle feature to switch between maintaining the image's original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  5. Supports flexible control over how images are displayed within their allocated preview space.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements (Frames, Groups, Text, Components, Instances, etc.) you want to preview and adjust.
  2. Click the "Generate Base64 Preview" button to create image previews.
  3. Use the toggle to switch between keeping the image’s original size or scaling it to fit the preview box.
  4. View the adjusted images and their corresponding dimensions directly within the plugin's interface.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports both raster images and vector elements.
  2. Images will be displayed in a fixed-size preview box, and resizing settings apply based on your toggle choice.
  3. The plugin works with selected elements in Figma's canvas, so ensure you have the right items selected before applying the tool.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Easily integrate and adjust image sizes for frames.

137639.name: 切图尺寸整合 Image Size Integration

plugins.name: Type Rhythm
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for efficiently adjusting typography in Figma. You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments, and adjust line height in 10% increments. It also allows you to convert Auto line height to 150%. Using tools like Keyboard Maestro to set up shortcuts can enhance your workflow.


Figmaでの文字調整を効率的に行うためのシンプルなプラグインです。フォントサイズを8px単位で増減でき、行間を10%単位で調整可能です。Keyboard Maestroなどのツールを使用してショートカットを設定することで、ワークフローをさらに効率化できます。
plugins.tagline: You can increase or decrease font size in 8px increments.

plugins.name: BableBox
plugins.description:
BableBox is a Figma plugin designed to make translating your interfaces a breeze. With a single click, it converts your entire design from one language to another, preserving context to ensure accurate, natural translations.


Say goodbye to the hassle of translating hundreds of words and phrases manually! BableBox leverages GPT-4o mini, one of the best AI models, which understands the context of each text to avoid errors (it intelligently skips icons and symbols like FontAwesome, for instance).


This plugin is perfect for designers and global teams looking for a fast, reliable, and easy solution to translate projects while maintaining content coherence and quality.


In short: a one-click translation tool built to save you time and reduce errors. 🌍🚀
plugins.tagline: BableBox: Translate your designs in one click, with perfect context 🌍

122575.name: BableBox
122575.description:
BableBox is a Figma plugin designed to make translating your interfaces a breeze. With a single click, it converts your entire design from one language to another, preserving context to ensure accurate, natural translations.


Say goodbye to the hassle of translating hundreds of words and phrases manually! BableBox leverages GPT-4o mini, one of the best AI models, which understands the context of each text to avoid errors (it intelligently skips icons and symbols like FontAwesome, for instance).


This plugin is perfect for designers and global teams looking for a fast, reliable, and easy solution to translate projects while maintaining content coherence and quality.


In short: a one-click translation tool built to save you time and reduce errors. 🌍🚀
122575.release_notes: You can fix your text in your language or target language using a GPT request.
122575.tagline: BableBox: Translate your designs in one click, with perfect context 🌍

plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer’s name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic 😉)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix “exclude-” to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


💬 Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I’d love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
👋 Hi! 
I’m a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.tagline: JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into JSON data.

plugins.name: One Click Export
plugins.description:
📌 ストーリー

フレームを指定してエクスポートをするときに、意図しない下の階層でエクスポートがされて悲しんでいる方々をたくさん見てきました。

そこで！少しでも役に立てればと思いプラグインを作っちゃいました！


このプラグインなら、セクションをクリックするだけで、その直下にあるフレームをボタンひとつで "カンタン" にエクスポートできちゃいます。

これで間違った階層でのエクスポートミスも防げるようになりました！

やったね🙌


📝 使い方

  1. プラグインを起動する
  2. セクションをクリックする
  3. セクション上にあるフレームがリストで表示されるので、順番にエクスポートのボタンをクリックする


⭐️ 今後のアップデート予定

  1. イケてるUIにする
  2. セクション上にあるフレームをまとめてエクスポートできるようにする
plugins.tagline: セクション直下にあるフレームをカンタンにエクスポートできる

plugins.name: Juxync
plugins.description:
Want to get alpha access to Jux? Visit jux.io


Jux is a code-based canvas design tool that plugs right into developer's codebase, enabling product designers to design the UI itself and developers its logic.

Creating a good color tokens system is a complex task. Use Juxync to import your variables to Jux to use as design tokens. Juxync will convert your variables collections, groups and modes into token sets to use in Jux. It will maintain all the relationships between variables.


How does Juxync work?

For more visual ‘how does it work‘, visit the knowledge base

  1. It scans Figma color variables in your chosen file.
  2. The plugin auto maps the tokens into core, and other semantics sets.
  3. Sync the tokens into the Jux token management, allowing developers to view and use these tokens via our CLI.


Next up: (or Future features)

  1. Sync Assets (SVG)
  2. Dimensions tokens
  3. Typography styles
  4. Check out the roadmap for more information


Want to be among the first to join the alpha? Join our community

accepted.name: Jux
accepted.description: We’re building a code-based design tool so designers can design the actual, real product as it will be used in production.

plugins.tagline: Juxync imports your Figma Variables as design tokens to Jux, seamlessly.

plugins.name: FontFig
plugins.description:
🤔 How it works:


  1. 1. Choose a font. This will be your base font - it can either be a font you want to manipulate or just help you get a good foundation for the different characters
  2. 2. Import the font. Fontfig will generate an artboard for every character and convert every character into an SVG.
  3. 3. Get creative. Manipulate or create totally new characters.
  4. 4. Export your new font (Whoop)


👉 Pointers:


  1. 📄 One Font can be created / edited per page
  2. 💾 Export each font up to 5 times for one price.
  3. 📐 Adjust the width of the artboard to change letter spacing for each character
  4. 💪 Support for more complex fonts coming soon


💬 We need your feedback:


  1. Drop us a comment or message if you see anything you think could be better. We want to continually improve this Plugin so your feedback is super helpful!
plugins.tagline: Create your own fonts in Figma

plugins.name: Export to Google Drive
plugins.description:
Direct export frame to google drive


How to use?


  1. Please select the frame to export.
  2. Run the "Export to Google Drive"
  3. Connect to Google Drive (A new tab will open to authorize this plugin.)
  4. Copy the authorization code from Google and paste it
  5. Enter Google Drive Folder ID
  6. Done! check your dirve!


*From now on, please enter only the folder ID and submit.

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
🧩 Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes — including all their children — with just a click.


✨ Features


- 🔍 Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- 🧾 Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ✅ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- 🌳 Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- 💾 Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ⚡️ Fast, no setup, no code required


---


🚀 How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click → Plugins → Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `✨ Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `🔧 Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


📦 Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


🔐 Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


🧠 Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


👨‍💻 Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children — quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!
plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

130750.name: Syntax Manager
130750.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!
130750.release_notes:
New Features:
- Inline syntax editing – Click directly on syntax values to edit them instantly.
- Prefix dropdown – Choose how templates are applied: Auto, Name, or Syntax mode.
- Multiple replacements – Use ; to apply several find/replace patterns in one step.

Enhancements:
- UI improvements for better clarity and usability
- Various bug fixes for a smoother, more reliable experience
130750.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: Gradiline
plugins.description:
Figma’s default gradient tools fall short for expressive path design.

Gradiline gives you full control over bezier-based gradients — with square end caps, rotation-aware handles, and node-level color precision. Shape vivid, dynamic visuals that break beyond linear constraints.
plugins.tagline: Gradiline — Draw gradients. Shape flow. Full control.

129015.name: Gradiline
129015.description:
Figma’s default gradient tools fall short for expressive path design.

Gradiline gives you full control over bezier-based gradients — with square end caps, rotation-aware handles, and node-level color precision. Shape vivid, dynamic visuals that break beyond linear constraints.
129015.tagline: Gradiline — Draw gradients. Shape flow. Full control.

plugins.name: Latin ⇄ Cyrillic
plugins.description:
Instantly flip any text layer—or whole frames—from Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.


🛠 How it works

• Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

• Run Plugins → “Latin ➜ Cyrillic” or “Cyrillic ➜ Latin”

• Fonts auto‑load, characters swap, you’re done


✨ Why it’s handy

• Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

• Handles digraphs (dž, lj, nj, dj) correctly

• Works inside components, variants, and instances

• Zero setup, zero UI—pure speed


⚠️ Limitations

• Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

• Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops
plugins.tagline: One‑click Serbian Latin ⇄ Cyrillic transliteration

128574.name: Latin ⇄ Cyrillic
128574.description:
Instantly flip any text layer—or whole frames—from Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.


🛠 How it works

• Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

• Run Plugins → “Latin ➜ Cyrillic” or “Cyrillic ➜ Latin”

• Fonts auto‑load, characters swap, you’re done


✨ Why it’s handy

• Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

• Handles digraphs (dž, lj, nj, dj) correctly

• Works inside components, variants, and instances

• Zero setup, zero UI—pure speed


⚠️ Limitations

• Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

• Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops

plugins.name: Smart Frame Organizer
plugins.description:
Smart Frame Tools helps you organize, duplicate, align, and rename frames in seconds — no dragging, no chaos.


Designed for precision layouts, this plugin includes smart features to:


Automatically rename frames left-to-right, top-to-bottom


Align selected frames into clean grids


Enforce consistent horizontal spacing


Duplicate and insert frames intelligently with automatic renaming


Perfect for UI designers, developers, and anyone working with structured layouts in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Smart Frame Tools — Precision layout. Effortless control.

128642.name: Smart Frame Organizer
128642.description:
Smart Frame Tools helps you organize, duplicate, align, and rename frames in seconds — no dragging, no chaos.


Designed for precision layouts, this plugin includes smart features to:


Automatically rename frames left-to-right, top-to-bottom


Align selected frames into clean grids


Enforce consistent horizontal spacing


Duplicate and insert frames intelligently with automatic renaming


Perfect for UI designers, developers, and anyone working with structured layouts in Figma.
128642.tagline: Smart Frame Tools — Precision layout. Effortless control.

plugins.name: Structura – Effortless Page Organization
plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.


Structura helps teams and designers maintain consistency across projects by enabling the creation, saving, and application of structured page layouts. Whether you prefer using built-in presets or custom templates, Structura simplifies your workflow, ensuring every file is clear and organized.



✨ Key Features


  1. Create & Save Custom Templates – Design your own page structures and reuse them effortlessly.
  2. Use Ready-Made Presets – Get started instantly with professionally designed page layouts.
  3. One-Click Template Application – Quickly apply a structure to any Figma file.
  4. Consistent File Organization – Standardize file layouts for better team collaboration.
  5. Easy Editing & Updating – Modify and update templates as your workflow evolves.



🚀 How to Use


  1. Choose a Template – Select from built-in presets or create your own.
  2. Apply to Your File – Instantly structure your Figma pages with one click.
  3. Customize as Needed – Edit sections or save new layouts for future use.
  4. Stay Organized – Ensure every file follows a consistent and streamlined structure.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly organize and standardize your Figma files with reusable page templates.

125948.name: Structura – Effortless Page Organization
125948.description:

  2. Use Ready-Made Presets – Get started instantly with professionally designed page layouts.
  3. One-Click Template Application – Quickly apply a structure to any Figma file.
  4. Consistent File Organization – Standardize file layouts for better team collaboration.
  5. Easy Editing & Updating – Modify and update templates as your workflow evolves.



🚀 How to Use

plugins.name: Detach Evolux
plugins.description:
Acelere seu fluxo de trabalho no Figma! Com este plugin, você pode desanexar instantaneamente todas as instâncias dentro de um frame, economizando tempo e simplificando seus projetos.


======================================================================


Boost your Figma productivity! Our plugin lets you quickly detach all instances in a frame, streamlining your design process.
plugins.tagline: Desanexe Componentes em um clique. Mantenha seus arquivos do Figma sempre organizados.

plugins.name: Jexity Tokens Exporter
plugins.description:
Jexity Tokens Exporter ables you to export variable collections and gradient styles into TailwindCSS configuration. This is to be used for TailwindCSS plugin.


For now, this can only be used for number and color variable types and for gradient styles. The plugin follows a specific structure and naming conventions, all of which are documented in the README.md file.
plugins.tagline: This ables you to export variable collections and gradient styles into TailwindCSS configuration.

plugins.name: bb-extract
plugins.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! 💫

93017.name: bb-extract
93017.description: With our Figma plugin, easily export design tokens to JSON format and gain the added advantage of live values! The plugin extends the 'import & export variables' example, streamlining the process by excluding imports and introducing a 'calculatedValue' property with actual color values (e.g., #00F instead of {colors.blue}). Now, you can seamlessly integrate design tokens directly into your codebase, making it a breeze to maintain a consistent design system. Simplify your design workflow and boost collaboration with this powerful plugin today!
93017.release_notes: Introduced a recursive check for local variables that reference other local variables, ensuring accurate calculation of values. This update resolves issues in previous versions where the target variable was located within a group inside a collection.
93017.tagline: Enhance your design token workflow with live values! 💫
